title: Refactor startTransaction() to use Action pattern
body:
## Summary

Refactor the `startTransaction()` method in `StatementServiceImpl` to follow the Action pattern, extracting the logic into a dedicated `StartTransactionAction` class.

## Context

As part of the ongoing refactoring of `StatementServiceImpl` (a 2,528-line God class), we're extracting each public method into focused Action classes. The `connect()` method has been implemented as a reference (see PR #XXX).

## Task

Extract the `startTransaction()` method logic into `StartTransactionAction`:

**Current code location**: `StatementServiceImpl.startTransaction()` (line ~1397)

**Target**: Create `org.openjproxy.grpc.server.action.transaction.StartTransactionAction`

## Implementation Steps

1. Create `StartTransactionAction` class implementing `Action<SessionInfo, SessionInfo>`
2. Extract logic from `StatementServiceImpl.startTransaction()` into the action
3. Update method to use `context.getSessionManager()` and other shared state
4. Update `StatementServiceImpl.startTransaction()` to delegate:
   ```java
   public void startTransaction(SessionInfo sessionInfo, StreamObserver<SessionInfo> responseObserver) {
       new StartTransactionAction(actionContext).execute(sessionInfo, responseObserver);
   }
   ```
5. Compile and test

## Complexity

**Simple** - Estimated 40-50 lines. Straightforward transaction start logic.

## Reference

- **Migration Guide**: [STATEMENTSERVICE_ACTION_PATTERN_MIGRATION.md](../documents/designs/STATEMENTSERVICE_ACTION_PATTERN_MIGRATION.md)
- **Reference Implementation**: PR #XXX (connect method)
- **Package**: `org.openjproxy.grpc.server.action.transaction`

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `StartTransactionAction` class created
- [ ] Logic extracted from `StatementServiceImpl`
- [ ] `StatementServiceImpl.startTransaction()` delegates to action
- [ ] Code compiles successfully
- [ ] Existing tests pass
- [ ] No functional changes (pure refactoring)
